intro: Dinochloa sublaevigata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved dinochloa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, elongated leaves that have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of many grass species. It is often found in moist, temperate environments, such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological studies in grassland ecosystems.
